qas.question: Under what name do research laboratories operated by IBM work under?
How many research labs does IBM have world wide?
In 2013 how many years had IBM generated the most patents by a business?
How many Nobel Prizes have been won by IBM employees?
This IBM invention is known by the acronym UPC, what is the full name?
How many labs work for the Watson company?
How long has Watson held the record for holding the most patents by a business?
How many Nobel Prizes has Watson been awarded?
What is one invention made by the Watson company that is used by people everyday?
What code was developed by Watson that's used in grocery stores?

context: IBM has <a1_0><b5_0>12<b5_0/> research laboratories worldwide<a1_0/>, bundled into <a0_0>IBM Research<a0_0/>. As of 2013[update] the company held the record for most patents generated by a business <b6_0>for <a2_0>22 consecutive years<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Its employees have garnered <a3_0><b7_0>five<b7_0/> Nobel Prizes<a3_0/>, six Turing Awards, ten National Medals of Technology and five National Medals of Science. Notable company inventions or developments include <b8_0>the automated teller machine (ATM)<b8_0/>, the floppy disk, the hard disk drive, the magnetic stripe card, the relational database, <b9_0>the <a4_0>Universal Product Code<a4_0/> (UPC)<b9_0/>, the financial swap, the Fortran programming language, SABRE airline reservation system, dynamic random-access memory (DRAM), copper wiring in semiconductors, the silicon-on-insulator (SOI) semiconductor manufacturing process, and Watson artificial intelligence.
